title: WATCH: Water Leakage At Bengaluru Airport's Terminal 2 Due To Heavy Rains; Several Flights Diverted To Chennai | Details
text: []https://www.india.com/karnataka/pics-man-flies-from-bangkok-with-10-yellow-anacondas-gets-caught-at-bengaluru-airport-6879091/ By clicking “Accept All Cookies”, you agree to the storing of cookies on your device to enhance site navigation, analyze site usage, and assist in our marketing efforts Cookies Policy . Flight operations were disrupted at the Bengaluru Airport in Karnataka Friday due to heavy overnight rainfall even as water seeped into Terminal 2 of the airport, forcing the authorities to divert as many as 17 flights to Chennai in Tamil Nadu. Visuals shared on social media platforms showed rainwater leaking through the ceiling of Terminal 2 at the Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru. Heavy rain hits Bengaluru airport: Leakage at Terminal 2; 17 flights diverted to Chennai [@BLRAirport] [pic.twitter.com/ODEglhY8WZ] — ChristinMathewPhilip (@ChristinMP_) [May 10, 2024] Officials said as many as 17 flights, including international passenger flights, were diverted due to the heavy rainfall and strong winds which made the airport inaccessible for landing for a brief period. “Heavy rainfall accompanied by strong winds rendered the airport inaccessible for landing between 9.35 pm and 10.29 pm, leading to diversion of flights,” a statement by a BIAL official said. The official said 13 domestic flights, three international passenger flights, and one international cargo flight were diverted to Chennai on Thursday. The overnight rains accompanied by str0ng winds also wreaked havoc in parts of Bengaluru city including, Jayanagar, Nrupathunga Nagar and RR Nagar, officials said. On the flip side, the rains also brought relief to the Bengaluru residents from the blistering summer heat, which they had not witnessed for many decades. The city has been receiving rain for the past four days. As per the India Meteorological Department (IMD), Bengaluru city received 14 mm rain in the 24-hour period till 8.30 am on Friday. In a statement, the weather agency said maximum and minimum temperature of the city stood at 33 and 22 degrees Celsius respectively in the last 24 hours.
